address: 228 Bleecker St, New York, NY 10014, USA
reviews: At 6:30pm the door was locked and no one was answering the phone. I left for 10 minutes to tell my sister at the restaurant next door and came back to find both Andrew and the other associate back with food. It's Sunday and the place closes at 7. They couldn't wait until 7 to grab dinner??

name: AT&T Authorized Retailer
address: 228 Bleecker St, New York, NY 10014, USA
reviews: I have NEVER been more inconvenienced in my life. Right now their line is busy. I have been trying for TWO days, in person and on the phone, to get a refund because they sold me a charger that did not work. Ridiculous. Our company uses ATT and I am going to ask them to switch. THE WORST.

name: AT&T Authorized Retailer
address: 228 Bleecker St, New York, NY 10014, USA
reviews: These guys are not a real AT&T store, and they have no scruples.  I had bought an unlocked tablet (a Google Nexus 9) that I simply wanted to add to my current plan (my current plan had no contract) and they went and put the tablet on a 2 year contract without telling me (probably so they could earn some commission or something).  When I wanted to deactivate it a few months later, I found out that I would have to pay a huge breakup fee for a device that was never supposed to be in a contract (that is the main reason people buy unlocked devices - so they dont get stuck with a contract).  I went back to this place twice in person, and 1.5 weeks later they still had not rectified the situation even though I visited the store twice, and when I called them after the 1.5 weeks they kept giving me the run around.  I eventually had the situation fixed by calling AT&T, and the lady at AT&T told me that in the future I should avoid stores that are authorized resellers and stick to real AT&T stores...

name: AT&T Authorized Retailer
address: 228 Bleecker St, New York, NY 10014, USA
reviews: Amazing store, Store Manager Oscar is very helpful. I recommend everyone to go this store.

name: AT&T Authorized Retailer
address: 228 Bleecker St, New York, NY 10014, USA
reviews: Could not imagine a more difficult place to deal with.Under the AT and T Next plan, I upgraded my phone to a newer model and left the older model with the manager of the store. When I was charged for the old phone not being returned to AT and T, I called customer service and referred back to the store. I proceeded to call the store five separate times and reached five separate employees, all of whom were different and claimed that they had no idea what I was talking about (for reference, this store is tiny). Each promised to call me back within 24 hours with a resolution to the issue; none did.Finally I reached the manager, who told me that they had lost several old phones meant to be sent back to AT and T. He promised me a resolution in 24 hours. After that time elapsed, he promised it within 48 hours. No resolution, no callback. Finally AT and T called me demanding the payment and after an hour on the phone with them they resolved it.This is a cliche "I never write reviews but I had to this time" deal: This store is awful, the employees are incompetent, inefficient and rude on the phone. Could not imagine a worse experience. Avoid, avoid, avoid.

name: AT&T
address: 129 1st Avenue, New York, NY 10003, USA
reviews: Amazing customer service! This is a franchised att store, not a corporate establishment.  This means the company owners are invested in your satisfaction! Highly recommend it.

name: AT&T
address: 129 1st Avenue, New York, NY 10003, USA
reviews: Very nice guys, very professional. Att the company made their contract purposely hard to understand, and these guys were able to explain it. Shame on ATT for making these guys' jobs so hard. Good for the guys for improvising.

name: AT&T

reviews: Exceptionally Rude and disrespectful!Came in with a question, left with some crappy attitude of the staff member.If you enjoy getting some snappy attitude... come on in  get your ears full :)

reviews: Complete fraudsters! They sold us a SIM card with a one month plan but it expired after 3 weeks. When we called to complain they claimed to extend it for us but again they were lying. We called Lyca Mobile and they had no record of them calling to escalate or extend the plan for us. They also charged us a bogus activation fee which they only told us about after the fact, and insisted on cash payment. If I couldgive them zero stars I would. Complete fraudsters and liars!

name: AT&T
address: 31 E 17th St, New York, NY 10003, USA
reviews: Mr. Gabriel was awesome helping me replace my stolen iPhone over my lunch break. Knowledgeable and personable, he dashed my fears of a drawn-out, expensive nightmare. (It definitely helped that the special they had perfectly fit my circumstances.) This was easily the best experience I've had of any phone/gadget purchase. No hard sell, no condescension, no rudeness, no sweat. I wish all customer services were this stress-free.

name: AT&T
address: 31 E 17th St, New York, NY 10003, USA
reviews: I was recently eligible to upgrade my phone, as I do the leasing per month plan and was dreading the whole process. Getting a new phone is always simultaneously exciting and a pain. In the past, I have gone into the AT&T in Oklahoma when I am home for Christmas thinking that the wait would be less and the service more friendly than the big city. Jeffrey Gabriel was my retail consultant and he shattered my stereotype. Easily the most friendly and professional AT&T associate I have ever interacted with, I felt that he perfectly balanced my needs and talking to me about my plan with representing AT&T. He helped me understand my plan better and what I could be doing to optimize it I I will now specifically return to this AT&T store for any phone needs. It is easy to get to and with employees like Jeffrey, I wouldn't be scared about dealing with phone issues and will keep me loyal to AT&T!!!

name: AT&T
address: 31 E 17th St, New York, NY 10003, USA
reviews: Endless phone menus. On hold for 12 minutes to get a human at what says "now, not very busy."  Not being able to get a human is torturous. Really disappointing. Now I have to make a special trip to the store just to chat with someone. Bad ATT

name: AT&T
address: 31 E 17th St, New York, NY 10003, USA
reviews: Waited 2hr just to buy an iphone 6 a year after its release.the costumer service is slow. They spent too much time taking to costumers about every little option and setting up their phones. Its seems like the costumers are at therapy. "So do you want to pay at once or on the next plan" let me give 15 min to think about it while i sit here with you".

name: AT&T
address: 31 E 17th St, New York, NY 10003, USA
reviews: Poor service and bad customer service the works don't try to help and they are very slow

name: AT&T
address: 209 W 34th St, New York, NY 10001, USA
reviews: The guy in the shop was rude. I ask him about unlocking my device which is an iPhone 6. I bought this device in ATT store next plan and I already paid off the phone. I ask him what should I do now because I already tried to call the customer service and they cannot solve my problem. But the guy told me they don't do unlock device in the shop and ask me to pay to unlock the phone in the shop that in the corner of the street. The assistant was very very unhelpful.  I was so disappointed with ATT. And I am going to switch to Verizon.

name: AT&T
address: 209 W 34th St, New York, NY 10001, USA
reviews: I broke my phone that was activated on Verizon. Fortunately, I had a old phone that I could activate temporarily, but it only worked on AT&T. I also had to catch a train right across the street at Penn Station, so was in a bit of a hurry. Loubna totally understood the problem, didn't try to sell me on anything extra, and was very friendly. If I worked in a midtown Manhattan store, I can GUARANTEE my attitude would not be nearly as pleasant as his. He hooked me up with a prepaid SIM, ported my number in no time at all and I was on my way. I would stay with AT&T if the service only worked in my building.  Thanks Loubna.

name: AT&T
address: 209 W 34th St, New York, NY 10001, USA
reviews: A great place for AT&T to shop for wallets. Staff are enslaved.

name: AT&T
address: 209 W 34th St, New York, NY 10001, USA
reviews: I loved the customer service. Omar was a great help. He hooked me up.

name: AT&T
address: 209 W 34th St, New York, NY 10001, USA
reviews: This store is horrible. They did not get anything done, no help what so ever. They made us wait about an hour and then told us that we have to go speak to a third party about a phone. Btw the phones the third parties sell are referbished.

name: AT&T
address: 200 5th Ave, New York, NY 10010, USA
reviews: The store manager Tai and Justin have been super patience and kind to have helped me with my TBR issues which I've had for over two weeks due to system errors. I spent over 10hrs in store and on phone just trying to get it done.  They were the only att reps that actually fixed the problems. Thank you both, especially Tai!

name: AT&T
address: 200 5th Ave, New York, NY 10010, USA
reviews: I just want to exchange a phone after getting my first phone for 5 days. Apparently they don't want to do it!!! The guy (C) was giving me attitude. He was so rude. After listened to my request, he never smiled or even looked at me in my eye. He goes in and asks me to write for 10 minutes and come back without offering apologies. Worst AT&T store experience ever!!!

name: AT&T
address: 200 5th Ave, New York, NY 10010, USA
reviews: Great customer service. Left happy. Thanks.

name: AT&T
address: 200 5th Ave, New York, NY 10010, USA
reviews: TERRIBLE customer service!!! Don't ever go to this location. All the staff should be fired. Customers come to ask questions and the salespeople act as if you're there "steal" the phones. Terrible, terrible location.

name: AT&T
address: 200 5th Ave, New York, NY 10010, USA
reviews: First couldn't find this place (it's actually closer to 24th).  Called the store and the phone rang off the hook. Quite bad for a phone company, no? Walked in here to be told there was a 20 minute wait just to talk to anyone. When I tried to pleasantly suggest I look at phones while I wait the girl told me not to, that I had to do everything with the rep. I kept trying to make light of the long wait and she just didn't get it and kept droning on (slowly) about how I had to just wait. Since I've been here a handful of people walked in, none of whom have been helped yet. Yet one more reason to cancel my contract the second it runs out! #CustomerService #Fail

name: AT&T
address: 16 W 34th St, New York, NY 10118, USA
reviews: The wait, OMG the waits! I've come here a couple of times to purchase new phones and every time they've made me wait for 30-45 minutes, while I can clearly see employees just standing around and hanging out or trying unendingly to upsell other customers. Just give them what they want and move on! Poor sales associates are probably just trying to hustle for their commissions and don't want to help the dude who be looking like he already knows what he wants and wants to get out the door. What's passed is past. Now I'm on Fi and good riddance to AT&T.

name: AT&T
address: 16 W 34th St, New York, NY 10118, USA
reviews: Excellent staff, knowledgeable, great for tourists who need sims, great selection of cases and helpful for small businesses in the area. Go to for telecommunications

name: AT&T
address: 16 W 34th St, New York, NY 10118, USA
reviews: Good store, and most times good service.  I think they should have Apple brand power cords rather than stock ones, which may or may not work.  I do like that they have a station where you can charge your phone

name: AT&T
address: 16 W 34th St, New York, NY 10118, USA
reviews: The AT&T in the Empire State Building is the place that you should go if you are looking for a new phone or accessories.  Reginald took great care of us all. Reginald took over two hours of his time to make sure that my Daughter Natalie and I were totally satisfied with our transaction. We bought a new iPhone. Reginald is very professional, polite and friendly. He is a great asset to AT&T. He made certain that my daughters new case and screen saver fit perfectly on her new phone. He is absolutely fantastic.  Jovan the manager of the store was great to work with too! Very professional and friendly too. He made sure every detail of my new bill would be exact. Jovan emailed me two days later to let me know that all of my credits were applied.Reginald and Jovan are great assets to AT&T! I highly recommend them for all of your needs! It's very refreshing to obtain that type of customer service that we both received!They were both gentlemen. Thank youGreg Nash

name: AT&T
address: 16 W 34th St, New York, NY 10118, USA
reviews: Worst customer service ever!! I've been to this location twice and have now learned my lesson.  The customer's come LAST at this store and I am never going back!  Both visits to this store had the same result, the manager was sitting around with his employees while the customers were waiting to be helped.  I asked the girl at the front why they couldn't help people and she said they were. I guess they were helping people in the video game they were all playing together? I wish I had thought to take a picture so I could emphasize what was really going on.  The manager here needs to be replaced but I guess the location (at the Empire State Building) keeps it looking successful even though it is so poorly run.

name: AT&T
address: 592 6th Ave, New York, NY 10011, USA
reviews: Needed a sim card.  They came thru really fast and I was out in like 15 minutes.

name: AT&T
address: 592 6th Ave, New York, NY 10011, USA
reviews: Went in today kind of distraught after breaking my iPhone the previous week. I literally have not been to an AT&T store since I had a Nokia phone in middle school and I really wasn't sure what to expect. I had our family account info but very little else and my mother and I have LONG SINCE lost our login info. We're kind of a mess. Bakari made everything better! He patiently helped my mother understand how to make me an authorized account holder over the phone and then walked me through the process of getting my phone. As a sales person, there's a real value in someone who understands how to explain transparently WHY things work the way they do, while also giving you clarity on the value of every option. He really brought me up to speed with how the billing works for new phones now (something that changed between the time I last bought my phone). While I am looking at years of paying off my new phone as opposed to the old experience of getting a new phone for less every few years, I feel like he educated me on every step of the process and helped me set myself up for the next time I need to upgrade so this doesn't happen again.  Baraki even put on my new screen protector and found the perfect case for my needs. Legitimately Apple has incredible customer service, but when it came to getting my new phone, I'm super happy I ended up going into the store today because it's been a really long time since I looked at exactly what our family is being charged and why when it comes to our phone service. My parents are getting older so now I feel confident I can understand and help us get more value for less money for the whole family. :)

name: AT&T
address: 592 6th Ave, New York, NY 10011, USA
reviews: Everyone is so kind and helpful here. I got a fast assistance.

name: AT&T
address: 592 6th Ave, New York, NY 10011, USA
reviews: Walked in there with an Iphone 6Plus from T-mobile new in the box someone gave to me with no account and my personal Iphone 4S with a verizon account for 45 dollars per month unlimited talk and text but verizon was being cheap with the data giving me only 500mb 3G per month and charging 5 dollars for every extra 500mb I added, oh well Verizon is not so bad I would had stay but they were not able to unlock the 6Plus T-mobile into their network for me, in the other hand T-molibe I am done with those guys for life they messed up  my bill too many times in the past. The Attendant at this location Mr. Lewis  was able to unlock the 6Plus from T-mobile and bring it into AT&T network, transfer my phone number which I had for years from Verizon into AT&T, offered me a plan of the same exact rate I was paying before unlimited talk, text, ANND Data, so it was a very good deal.

name: AT&T
address: 592 6th Ave, New York, NY 10011, USA
reviews: All the reviews I read before going to the store were all from a year ago or longer therefore at first I was skeptical about going to said store because of all the previous reviews being so negative, but I came to find none of them were true.    The service is amazing and the staff is superb, especially compared to the AT&T store off Morgan Ave in Brooklyn.   I was immediately greeted and helped upon walking into the store and offered a bottle of water by Leo, a current employ who made my cell phone upgrade experience, quick painless and easy.    The cherry on top of awesomeness that is this particular AT&T store was when after everything was said and done, Leo the employ who helped me out, walked me out and held the door open for me as I was leaving. When small things like that happen in a big dark city such as New York, it really does make my day a little brighter.   Great store, great service, good people.

name: AT&T
address: 476-478 Fulton St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
reviews: I went to the Fulton mall store to get my watch turned on. After a couple of hours the watch went out. I called the store back and no one answered. You only have a few helpers who will take time with you. The others will walk around and talk on company time.

name: AT&T
address: 476-478 Fulton St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
reviews: went in to arrange new service for monthly plan with my own phone. agent was happy enough to complete my trransaction, but failed to mention that since my phone is not an ATT phone, i can't be guaranteed 4G LTE service, only HSPA+ (which is glorified 3G) until AFTER i had completed the transaction. when i asked for a refund, he stated that i could not receive said refund because I had already paid.had I been educated prior to spending $65 about this non-guarantee, then I would not have asked for a refund, but since I was not properly informed about the limitations of service, I consider this fraud.

name: AT&T
address: 476-478 Fulton St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
reviews: Great Service when I had to replace my Galaxy Note 7

name: AT&T
address: 476-478 Fulton St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
reviews: Brittaney was great--despite it being 20 mins before closing on New Year's Eve, she took the time to get us set up with new phones, change our contract etc. etc.  Really efficient and friendly and gave us good tips on specials AT&T was running without trying to pressure us into buying something we weren't interested in.

name: AT&T

reviews: A standard AT&T store, there is a bit of a wait to see a representative but not anything unreasonable. I spent about 20-25 minutes total to get a replacement SIM card.

name: AT&T

reviews: Absolutely the worst customer service I've ever had. I don't usually leave reviews but this was so bad I had to. Unhelpful, rude, and a waste of 20 minutes. The employee basically said "I don't manage the online site, can't help you. Try to figure it out yourself!"

name: AT&T

reviews: I was there yesterday and I can say it was a very pleasant experience and everyone in the store was very attentive they hooked me up with new phone and iPad!

name: AT&T
address: 745 Broadway, New York, NY 10003, USA
reviews: Such cavalier and uncaring customer service is difficult to find. Although their corporate customer service had told me I could return the product I had purchased at any AT&T store they refused to do it, and refused to even look at my account. Stay far far away.

name: AT&T
address: 745 Broadway, New York, NY 10003, USA
reviews: I went in there with questions about prepaid sim cards and Latasha was very knowledgable and helpful. Great customer service

name: AT&T
address: 260 Canal St, New York, NY 10013, USA
reviews: I went to exchange a defective iPhone, after being directed by AT&T mobile customer care due to the dead pixels on the screen, only to be turned down by the shop. My phone had zero signs of physical damage, within the 30 day warranty, within the 7-14 day return/exchange policy and the phone was insured.The shop informed my that the phone can only be returned to the location it was purchased because there was no way to determine that the phone was sold with the dead pixels.I'm cancelling my 10+ year with Cingular/AT&T and reversing my upgrade for a full refund. I will take my business across the street to Verizon.

name: AT&T
address: 260 Canal St, New York, NY 10013, USA
reviews: One of the best customer service experiences I have ever had. Brian O'Connor (Retail Sales Consultant) and Perry Kwan (Retail Sales Manager) answered all of my questions, addressed all of my concerns and really went above and beyond when it came to the level of customer service I received. For this reason, I am happily terminating my Verizon Wireless account (I asked them about turning in my Note 3 for a new iPhone 6 plus and they did not offer any incentives - even though I am technically still a customer - no flexibility on pricing, etc.). They didn't even try to assist me but instead just quoted the exorbitant price I would have had to pay for a new phone. I look forward to a long and happy relationship with ATT. Thank you Brian and Perry for the excellent service and I look forward to seeing you both when my phone arrives!

name: AT&T
address: 260 Canal St, New York, NY 10013, USA
reviews: Susie was helpful and knowledgeable.Fair play breakdown no over sell.Thanks!

name: AT&T
address: 260 Canal St, New York, NY 10013, USA
reviews: Rude serice and dumb people.  Been a customer for 8 years and i will NOT choose att!

It did got solved at the end while I enjoy the AC in the store. I would think the store staff can do something about it.

name: AT&T

reviews: Very good customer service. I bought a tariff plan,  everything was quick and easy. Thanks,  Jamie!

name: AT&T
address: 82 Wall St, New York, NY 10005, USA
reviews: Got help quickly, swapped my phone during a lunch break just fine. Was prepared for the worst after reading these comments, but it was actually really painless. Just wanted to give them some credit where credit is due.

name: AT&T
address: 82 Wall St, New York, NY 10005, USA
reviews: This is the worst AT&T store in New York. If you're going to this store to make changes to your account, the ignorant representative will most likely ask you to call AT&T customer service. I went in the other day to inquire about repair to my damaged phone which is covered by insurance. I was shocked when they handed me a business card to a third-party unauthorized dealer on Maiden Lane. They probably don?Ñ?t know that work performed by unauthorized stores would void the manufacturer warranty.Not sure if AT&T should continue to keep this store open because it is clearly damaging the reputation of the AT&T brand on WALL STREET.

name: AT&T
address: 82 Wall St, New York, NY 10005, USA
reviews: I come here a lot because it is close to my home, and they have decent hours and everything I need for my iPhone. I've bought three iPhones here. Twice insurance was added without my consent. I cancelled it using the app both times, but this is a really annoying and illegal business practice.Just slightly better than Verizon.

The store also enrolled me in the expensive and useless insurance plan when I said I didn't want it.  Took me three calls to Att to remove the insurance.  Crooks.  Do not do business here.

Don't come to this store it is the WORST !!I'm sorry that I didn't believe previous reviews. They were right!!

name: AT&T
address: 3764 Wilshire Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90010, USA
reviews: Daniel T. was an AWFUL representative. Not only did he seem fully disengaged, and disinterested in working, I had to prompt HIM to tell me about the phones and the differences as I was looking to upgrade. When I asked him if he was having a good day, he replied with, "I have a cough".  Well maybe he should've stayed home? He also made an error when it was time to charge my payment appropriately. No apology but more of an unaccountable shrug blaming it on the "system". He then gives me my boxed phone, no contract description (which I later obtained from the incredible manager named Rae) and walked off to help someone else which not so much as a thank you or anything. Mind you, the phone I had was not working so why would you just send me on my way with no instructions?? I had to get the help of another representative to help me get the new phone up and running just so I could speak on it. Daniel T even STOPPED working with his customer to come and speak with me so I wouldn't escalate it to a manager. I had no interest in speaking to or dealing with him and told him to go back to his WAITING CUSTOMER. Insane. ALL OF THIS CAME ON THE HEELS OF AN ENORMOUS MESS UP ON OUR BILLBY AT&T THAT RESULTED IN OVER 7 HOURS OF PHONE TIME WITH YOUR REPS TO RESOLVE AN ISSUE THAT YOU CREATED. VERY POOR SERVICE. OVER SEVER HOURS OF PHONE TIME AND TEO TRIPS TO YOUR STORE....A HUGR EASTE OF TIME THAT YOU CREATED.

name: AT&T
address: 3764 Wilshire Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90010, USA
reviews: They recently remodeled store. nice store and nice people.

name: AT&T
address: 3764 Wilshire Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90010, USA
reviews: I was so angry and upset at the horrible service.  When I ordered the internet service, they gave me the wrong modem and router and then shipped me two routers and open two separate accounts and double charged me.  And, when I called the customer service, they did not even care and left  the charges in both accounts and sent me to collection. I couldn't pay for something that was not  correct.  It was an extortion act  by AT&T. Someone should stop AT&T from its crime spree.  Not only that, AT&T cut off my parents' phone line and internet and jack up their rates when I refused to pay for mine.

name: AT&T
address: 3764 Wilshire Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90010, USA
reviews: I live in an area with limited cell phone coverage, so I have a land line for my home phone.The land line has been out of service for a week. It is a problem in the AT&T line, we have called every day and as you know getting through the automated telephone answering system at AT& T is a nightmare.  And everyday they state they will fix the problem tomorrow. Well tomorrow for fixing the AT&T problem has not arrived. And who ever dreamed up their automated answering system should be made to use it.

name: AT&T
address: 3764 Wilshire Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90010, USA

No help to resolve my problem!!

reviews: Went in there to get PREPAID wifi and SIM card.Waiting time was long but the stuff very helpful and I got exactly what I was looking for. Had to go there again after two days as I had some refill issues with the wifi.They got it sorted out in minutes.One more happy customer.

name: AT&T
address: 1112 N La Brea Ave, West Hollywood, CA 90038, USA
reviews: The worst store you could  ever walked in. Kiosks don't work, always had to wait in line, absolutely helpless.

name: AT&T Authorized Retailer
address: 3150 Wilshire Blvd #120, Los Angeles, CA 90010, USA
reviews: Please do not purchase sim card or upgrade to 15gb plan for Mexico!!! I have spoke to Jimmy Ramirez (store manager) for the sim card that did not work for me. He couldn't  refund the card since it was used. I have explain my situation  before I purchased the card that I am planing to use it for navigation for the church mission. Our group got lost passing the border, because I was depending on the gps that didn't work.  With all the constructions, it was hard to navigate with out the street signs on the streets. The sim card did work for couple of calls when I was in the Encinada, but that was about it. Jimmy said that not all the city are up to date with the cell towers in the Mexico... and it's true here, too that not all places have receptions... Okay sooo switch to Verizon or what???So, don't buy a sim card for Mexico at AT&T store. You will be wasting $69.10 the only sim card option.The manager said that AT&T will still sell the card that does not work. I just don't want people to get lost depending on the GPS in Mexico.Your other option would be buying a sim card thru Amazon that sells TelCel cards for $15, $25, $30 with different plans.I have been faithful customer since Cingular before AT&T.

name: AT&T Authorized Retailer
address: 3150 Wilshire Blvd #120, Los Angeles, CA 90010, USA
reviews: At this site I found out that the experience here was very unsatisfactory. I was signed up for u-verse, and direct TV bundle. While there everything was going ok until the installation process was to take place. A problem with the work order was brought up so I had to wait an additional days to get any updates. When that time expired and I was assured that it would all be taken care of, I never received any information from the representative that first took my order. After the initial setup I was never communicated with and I was the one contacting. I feel that was insufficient customer service. I would not recommend this site to any one.

name: AT&T Authorized Retailer
address: 3150 Wilshire Blvd #120, Los Angeles, CA 90010, USA
reviews: Poor customer service. Completely understaffed. Expect long waiting periods for simple solutions.

name: AT&T Authorized Retailer
address: 3150 Wilshire Blvd #120, Los Angeles, CA 90010, USA
reviews: Worst customer service not professional at all. I went there on 22nd may Sunday afternoon to upgrade my phone the sales person was a little Korean American girl who was very rude and was acting like if she is doing a big favor by answering my questions made me so uncomfortable that I had to leave but the same day I went to better location and had my phone upgrade.

name: AT&T Authorized Retailer
address: 3150 Wilshire Blvd #120, Los Angeles, CA 90010, USA
reviews: No one working in this store ever seems to be particularly helpful and I'm pretty sure (read: sure) that at least some of the employees make up additional fees and pocket the cash. Unfortunately, all cell phone stores seem to suck, so even considering the above, this one is prob better than average. Plus there's a garage with free parking for customers (with validation).

name: AT&T
address: 8471 Beverly Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90048, USA
reviews: I needed to upgrade my phone since it decided to commit suicide by leaping from my hand and shattering. I usually go to the store on Robertson and Olympic......for the past 7 years. But they have converted to a T mobile store.  Have to say my experience with T Mobile has not been good in the past. I actually used to live 4 buildings down from their largest cell tower ( according to them) but could only get a signal if I went outside. So I was a bit unsure about switching back. Then I was told that no one does payment plans anymore and I would have to buy my phone outright. Not good for my budget. Long story short........ I walked into the AT&T store on Beverly Blvd today. I was immediately greeted before the door closed behind me. The sales associate Jonathan was freaking awesome. Being from a sales background I am pretty cautious and am very aware of up selling . Not only was he extremely curtious, he also saved me some money on my bill while upping my gigs. Nor did he try to sell me anything I didn't need! To top it off the manager stopped by to make sure my experience was perfect. Way to go guys!!!! I almost went to another company...but you, without knowing it, won me over again! Very rare to receive quality customer service and these guys rocked it.

name: AT&T
address: 8471 Beverly Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90048, USA
reviews: They may be a bit crowded and slow sometimes but it still doesnt make them loose a star for being the most helpful ATT store I have encountered in 10 years.  If ATT corporate gets it wrong they will fix it. To their with Patience and ask them to help and they will take care of you and go beyond their duty.  My definition of 5 star in this day and age.  Current management is rock solid and the old people there in 2015 that may have been less than 5 star are GONE.  :). And I spend too much money their but that's my fault. The alarm system is awesome

name: AT&T
address: 8471 Beverly Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90048, USA
reviews: Crappie customer service. Sales people just don't give a sh...t.  They moving with no purpose, they just don't care.  Help!  Get me outta here.  Even the manager is a sloth! OMG.

name: AT&T
address: 8471 Beverly Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90048, USA
reviews: I came in because I had heard about a deal they were offering on a mini tablet computer and the guy I spoke to helped me right away --I didn't have to wait at all --and directed me toward a better deal on a mini tablet computer. he checked me out quickly , he offered to help me set it up and he advised me on how to reduce my monthly bill. an excellent experience all around

name: AT&T

name: AT&T Authorized Retailer

reviews: my business has been rapidly and this AT&T store has been there from the beginning. I am responsible for running a large family-owned trucking and logistics company. this store was able to meet all my business needs. They were able to supply my organization with the fleet tracking technology necessary to grow our business. I could probabably go on but if you have a business, this is the store to go to!

name: AT&T Authorized Retailer
address: 5600 Wilshire Blvd a, Los Angeles, CA 90036, USA
reviews: It's been about 18 months so it was time to upgrade my cell phone.  I had two options: (1) to be on hold for eternity only to speak to a thick South-Asian accented fellow named "John," or (2) go to the ATT store and wade through all the useless plan additions they try to upsell.  Anyways, I decided to take my chances at this ATT store, which I think just opened.  There I told them what I wanted (the new LG G3!) and that I absolutely did not need any other random changes to my account.  The guy who was helping me out was named Denny or Danny (sorry, I forgot which, hah).  Real nice guy who didn't try to push anything on me.  He went out of his way to explain the breakdown of all the fees.In the end, I realize that it's their job to be nice and try to be helpful, but Denny/Danny was very sincere with his eagerness to help.  And plus points, he speaks perfect english.

name: AT&T Authorized Retailer
address: 5600 Wilshire Blvd a, Los Angeles, CA 90036, USA
reviews: Came out to L.A. for a Venture Capital business conference. My iphone 6s started acting up. I stopped by the store and the store associates were extremely helpful. They got me back on the road in a heartbeat! Best AT&T Store in Greater Los Angeles!

address: 3016 N Broadway, Lincoln Heights, CA 90031, USA
reviews: My experience at this location was great. My rep was Mauricio, and he did an excellent job at explaining what my options were in regards to upgrading to a new phone. The store seems to be understaffed and I can understand why other people complain about the rep trying to multitask and  help two customers at the same time, but if you are patient enough I think it's worth the wait considering that if you do go to one of their Corporate Stores the wait time is usually no less than one hour. And to the person who left the review saying the company is owned my middle eastern people, do your self a favor and go drown in the middle of the Dead Sea, if you google Springmobile, and do your research before stereotyping anyone, you'd find that their parent company is Gamestop and that their main office is based off  in Utah, and whose CEO happens to be Caucasian. Anyway, I would definitely recommend this place, customer service is great, and wait time is not as bad.

name: AT&T Authorized Retailer
address: 3016 N Broadway, Lincoln Heights, CA 90031, USA
reviews: I went into this store that is owned by Spring Mobile Inc. and not At&t to get a new SIM card for my existing phone. The Employee removed the backing from my phone incorrectly and ruined it. One of the little prongs that hold it on near the top was sheered off when she improperly removed it. Now the backing will not stay on. She refused to take responsibility. Choosing not to argue, I chose to call back the Manager Victor Ruiz the next day. He said to send him pictures of the damage. I did that and called him back. Then he said that someone will make a decision on it and contact me next week. I called back again to say that I want my phone replaced now. He is avoiding me and refusing to come to the phone. I have called and asked for hi twice and been left sitting on hold for over an hour, two times. Just do yourself a favor and if you don't want trouble, do your AT&T shopping at a CORPORATE AT&T STORE and one one of these stores owned by foreign middle eastern people that make up their own rules and don't car about Customers.

name: AT&T Authorized Retailer
address: 712 Fair Oaks Ave, South Pasadena, CA 91030, USA
reviews: In addition to being unable to get us a working phone plan,  the employee was condescending without even having the knowledge to justify it.  He showed us information in the computer that was 3 years out of date and was rude when we pointed out it was old.  He told us incorrect information.  He could not find order information in the system from a week or two prior.  He didn't really understand the computer system, saying some numbers that were on his screen shouldn't be there (employees at other locations verified it should).  Finally, despite being unable to get SIM cards for our phones, he tried to push a larger data plan on us anyway.

reviews: This place sucks I went to try and get a upgrade and tried to trade my iPhone 3GS for a galaxy 4 and they tried to give me $28 for it when my mom went they gave her $100 for her 3G and was able to get her galaxy 4 and they said that's the best they can do what kind of crap is that they gave her $100 for her older phone and I have one a little newer and tried to rip me off never again will I go to this store makes me want to go to another company

name: AT&T
address: 5057 Whittier Blvd, East Los Angeles, CA 90022, USA
reviews: Worst AT&T store ever. I always forget NOT to come here. Kiosk are always faulty, they're under staffed, wait time for service averages 1 hr and did I mention how rude the staff is? This store gives at&t a bad name. I'd rather sit in traffic on Atlantic to go to the Monterey Park store.

name: AT&T
address: 5057 Whittier Blvd, East Los Angeles, CA 90022, USA
reviews: Definetly the worst at&t I have ever been ...they all lie and tell you a diffent story..I broke my phone and I was paying it but I want it to get another phone because I cant be without phone for my work...so one person told me I could do it...another I cant...another put me to speak with a representative from a phone from the store...the representative was really rude and told me I had to pay all the amount of the phone for me to get a new one...but It was barely a month I had chance my phone so I had to pay 900 for me to have a line...diffent stories...no one help...I waited there about 3 hours and nothing...never getting at&t again!

reviews: Never buying a phone here again...they rush to close the sell and the guy never explained me the plan and never spoke to me about the insurance ...Two months after I end up paying a useless phone after my child broke it and they didn't even wanted to connect my line with another phone because I needed to finish pay that phone please 900 in one pay...definetly they seem like their helping you but they all really care for they comission...never coming back

name: AT&T
address: 2200 S Atlantic Blvd, Monterey Park, CA 91754, USA
reviews: I came to this store last May 2015, and it took them 3 hours to activate my new phone, ridiculous!  well today I found out my phone that I purchase was not a new phone it was a certified used phone, be careful when you go to this store and buy a new phone, they might sell you a certified used phone, and what is worse is that they claim all their phones are new, blah! NOT TRUE...

reviews: Horrible staff. My friends were sold 3 ipad minis by lying then that they were ipad mini 2. When they realized that they got cheated and went there to ask the response was what you'd eject from an At&T rep

name: AT&T Authorized Retailer
address: 150 Silhavy Rd #100, Valparaiso, IN 46383, USA
reviews: Been with att for a long time,  the staff here has always been  very helpful when I've had questions or brought a phone in to be activated.

name: AT&T Authorized Retailer
address: 5222 S Lake Park Ave, Chicago, IL 60615, USA
reviews: Absolutely horrible. The girl "helping" me had no idea what she was doing and was more interested in playing with her phone. Manager was talking on their cell the whole time,- should have noticed she was struggling but didn't seem to care. She did so many incorrect things on my account that it took a representative at the 1-800 number over an hour to fix her errors- including putting in the wrong social security number after I repeated it to her twice and wrote it down. Take the trip somewhere else, avoid this store.

name: AT&T Authorized Retailer
address: 5222 S Lake Park Ave, Chicago, IL 60615, USA
reviews: There is not a sing in list, so there is not evidence how long you have to wait to receive a bad services.

name: AT&T Authorized Retailer
address: 5222 S Lake Park Ave, Chicago, IL 60615, USA
reviews: The staff was incredibly unhelpful. Everyone acted nice, but they were extremely lazy and didn't go out of their way to help in any way. They only answered direct questions and didn't offer any suggestions for specific ways that AT&T could help. When they ran into an issue with looking up my account in the computer they said I had to call AT&T. When I asked to speak with a manager, the girl who'd been playing on her phone the entire time said that she was (no, it didn't appear to be official AT&T business on her phone) and that there was no way she could help. Zero stars for problem solving.

name: AT&T Authorized Retailer
address: 5222 S Lake Park Ave, Chicago, IL 60615, USA
reviews: The sales guy was very helpful in getting me a new bluetooth and car charger and getting me back on the road on my vacation. The headset is great.

name: AT&T Authorized Retailer
address: 5222 S Lake Park Ave, Chicago, IL 60615, USA
reviews: This store really sucks!! Actually it's not an ATT direct store, but only a retailer who cannot execute many of the essential jobs for customers. The working atmosphere here is horrible, people at work sing, listen to music, dance, tease around, talk and laugh loudly... regardless the customers' presence and ongoing formal business. I couldn't even talk on my phone cuz I kept disrupted by the extremely noisy surroundings.What's worse, the service attitude is really bad and cold. The manager is really relaxed at work and impatient to customers' questions; the staff are not professional at all: they always give customers totally different opinions regarding to simple questions, and when any mistake is made by them or the real problems come, they just don't know what to do, keep sending customers to the direct ATT store at downtown, trying to shrug off their responsibilities. They don't even express any SINCERE apologies after costing customers' hours of waiting while with literally "no-progress" at all.I doubt how this unproductive and trouble making store would survive until now or in the future. It just leaves me really bad impression about these people's working attitude and basic respect to others, let alone toward the customers.

name: AT&T Authorized Retailer
address: 4000 N Lincoln Ave, Chicago, IL 60618, USA
reviews: Unwelcoming environment, passive aggressive salespersons, no problem-solving skills or interest in customer care. If you have a phone WITH insurance and another 12 months on contract, better hope your phone doesn't suddenly break. Because they won't fix it in-store. They won't sell you a new one in-store. You have to call a special phone number (from whatever phone around you that actually works) and wait however long (weeks most likely) for a new phone to be sent to you. Your other option: bring it to an independent repair shop. That's what they actually told me to do. Bring it to a repair shop and pay extra money to fix the phone THEY sold me. If I buy a burger from McDonald's and ask for no condiments and they smother it in mayonnaise and ketchup...do I have to take it to another store...or call a special phone number? LAZINESS.

name: AT&T Authorized Retailer
address: 4000 N Lincoln Ave, Chicago, IL 60618, USA
reviews: My experience was great. Miguel helped me solve the issue with my billing quickly and efficiently. Nice environment.  Thanks!

name: AT&T Authorized Retailer
address: 4000 N Lincoln Ave, Chicago, IL 60618, USA
reviews: Really really bad experience...not appropriate to publish in a public forum...dealing directly with ATT.  Note that this store is not really ATT---its a privately owned agent.  In future I will stick with actual ATT stores

name: AT&T Authorized Retailer
address: 4000 N Lincoln Ave, Chicago, IL 60618, USA
reviews: Most of my experience at phone stores has been long, painful, and grueling. I set aside a significant chunk of time to go in after my phone stopped working. I got to the store, was greeted hapily, helped right away and out of there within 10 minutes. The people here are friendly and helpful.

name: AT&T Authorized Retailer
address: 4000 N Lincoln Ave, Chicago, IL 60618, USA
reviews: I came into the store to update my iPhone. I worked with Jeff, who was extremely helpful and walked me through everything. When his scheduled appointment arrived, Garret made sure to hang out and ensure my phone was updated correctly. I was very satisfied with the experience and would feel confident with either of these great employees.

name: AT&T Authorized Retailer
address: 20 S Clinton St, Chicago, IL 60661, USA
reviews: Lousy staff. Rude, sarcastic, unhelpful, lazy. I've tried to give this location numerous chances to do better but they continue to disappoint. Terrible.

name: AT&T Authorized Retailer
address: 20 S Clinton St, Chicago, IL 60661, USA
reviews: I went to this store on 22 June at 6 PM . It took them 2 hrs to activate my sim . A lady at front desk is continuously  talking to someone .representatives were not at all responsible for the customers who step in . This is my second worst experience at this store with the same lady . I would suggest the store manager to look into this . It takes 2 min activate a sim .and the lady suggested me to call att customer care . I don't understand why do I have to call customer care when I am at this store . After all the waiting time for 2 hrs I went into att store on Adams street which took 2 mins for them to activate my sim . Worst ever service .
